revised_title: Elucidation of an Etruscan Coin of Paestum
tldr: The author examines an Etruscan coin from Paestum, in Lucania, and provides insights into its origin, symbols, and possible meaning. The coin's design and inscriptions suggest it was produced in a maritime city and date back to the time of the Social War. The author also discusses the Etruscan characters and their use on coins during that period.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Archaeology
